alert.note: Alert for Gove; Graham; Logan; Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 3:14AM CDT until June 17 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Kansas and west central Kansas, including the following counties, in northwest Kansas, Graham, Norton, Sheridan and Thomas. In west central Kansas, Gove and Logan. * WHEN...Until noon CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 312 AM CDT, Doppler radar estimates between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the warned area on Friday going into Saturday morning. Additional rainfall is possible. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oakley, Hill City, Hoxie, Quinter, Grainfield, Grinnell, Gove, Lenora, Selden, Morland, Bogue, Monument, Park, Menlo, Clayton, Nicodemus, Edmond, Tasco, Studley and Seguin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
